{"id":1080989640,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"3 weeks, 4 days","timestamp":1697942524,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"111 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1080989640/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Minimum Sum of Mountain Triplets II","memory":"80.5 MB","code":"#include <vector>\n#include <iostream>\n#include <algorithm>\n\nclass Solution {\npublic:\n    int minimumSum(std::vector<int>& nums) {\n        int n = nums.size();\n        \n        if (n < 3) {\n            return -1; // Not enough elements for a mountain triplet\n        }\n        \n        std::vector<int> left_min(n, 0);\n        std::vector<int> right_min(n, 0);\n\n        left_min[0] = nums[0];\n        for (int i = 1; i < n; i++) {\n            left_min[i] = std::min(left_min[i - 1], nums[i]);\n        }\n\n        right_min[n - 1] = nums[n - 1];\n        for (int i = n - 2; i >= 0; i--) {\n            right_min[i] = std::min(right_min[i + 1], nums[i]);\n        }\n\n        int min_sum = INT_MAX;\n        for (int j = 1; j < n - 1; j++) {\n            if (nums[j] > left_min[j] && nums[j] > right_min[j]) {\n                min_sum = std::min(min_sum, nums[j] + left_min[j] + right_min[j]);\n            }\n        }\n\n        return (min_sum != INT_MAX) ? min_sum : -1;\n    }\n};\n\n\n","compare_result":"","title_slug":"minimum-sum-of-mountain-triplets-ii","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
